snippet: Enthusiasts of Nikola Tesla, an eccentric genius who lit the world with alternating current but died penniless, have finally succeeded in raising enough money to buy the property.
abstract: Enthusiasts of Nikola Tesla, best known for establishing alternating current as the basis for modern electricity, raise enough money to buy the inventor's only surviving workshop, which sits on 16 acres in Shoreham, Long Island; group purchased the crumbling brick structure, designed by Stanford White, for around $1.4 million, and plans to create a museum and educational memorial.
lead_paragraph: Enthusiasts of Nikola Tesla, an eccentric genius who lit the world with alternating current but died penniless, have finally succeeded in raising enough money to buy the property.
